column4: Hi, I'd like help changing my background picture for the logon screen. Using gnome.
iirc the GDM currently in use by the latest ubuntu doesnt support theming at all
Then whan may I change it to? :)  I want it to bee good looking ;D
Or rather, what is aviable for graphical login managers? :)  Changing it i'll manage
KDM is KDE's Display Manager, i fancy it personally
Oh, is it themeable? :)
indeed.  last i checked
Thanks
but that was back for using kde 3.5
i would imagine nothing has changed in terms themeability
I'll check it out, thanks
Will changing to KDM make any other diffrence than my logon?
its gunna install a bunch of packages subsequently, but youll still be able to select "Gnome" for your desktop environment at the login screen
mind you you'll need to chmod -x /etc/init.d/gdm for kdm to step in
What'll that do? :)
takes executeable permission away from GDM, so KDM can step in
Ah, thanks
otherwise theyll engage in battle
That line doesn't work, it demands a "missing operand after /etc/init.d/gdm"
? sudo chmod -x /etc/init.d/gdm
Hey, that didn't go very well D:
I didn't set my session to Gnome, So i logged into KDE without anny packages :D Empty, screen with only a console. yay :D
